About Mount Kilimanjaro

Mount Kilimanjaro is Africa's highest peak and the world's tallest free-standing mountain. Located in Tanzania, this majestic dormant volcano rises approximately 4,900 meters from its base and includes three volcanic cones: Kibo, Mawenzi, and Shira.

With African Royalty Safaris, you'll experience a carefully planned ascent that maximizes your chances of reaching Uhuru Peak while ensuring your safety and comfort throughout the journey. Our expert guides, porters, and comprehensive support system make this challenging adventure accessible to determined individuals with proper preparation.

Climbing Routes

Choose the path that matches your experience and preferences

Machame Route (7 days)

Known as the "Whiskey Route," this popular path offers beautiful scenery and excellent acclimatization.

  • Scenic and diverse landscapes
  • High success rate
  • Moderate to difficult challenge
  • Camping accommodation
Learn More

Marangu Route (6 days)

Often called the "Coca-Cola Route," this is the only route with hut accommodation.

  • Hut accommodation available
  • Most direct route to summit
  • Less challenging but steeper
  • Shorter duration option
Learn More

Lemosho Route (8 days)

Considered the most beautiful route with high success rates due to excellent acclimatization.

  • Stunning scenic variety
  • Excellent acclimatization profile
  • Less crowded
  • Higher success rate
Learn More

Rongai Route (7 days)

The only route approaching from the north, offering a more remote wilderness experience.

  • More remote and less crowded
  • Gentler slope at beginning
  • Better during rainy season
  • Wilderness experience
Learn More

Preparation Guide

How to prepare for your Kilimanjaro climb

Physical Training

Begin training 3-6 months in advance with cardiovascular exercise, strength training, and hiking with a weighted pack.

Gear & Equipment

We provide a detailed packing list. Essential items include quality hiking boots, layered clothing, and a warm sleeping bag.

Health & Altitude

Consult with your doctor, consider altitude medication, and understand the symptoms of altitude sickness.

Travel Documents

Ensure your passport is valid for at least 6 months, obtain a Tanzanian visa, and have travel insurance that covers high-altitude trekking.
